headline.main: FIGHT IN SOLOMONS; U.S. Fliers Ward Off Big Enemy Raid, Downing Sixteen Planes FOE'S SURFACE FORCE HIT Our Heavy Bombers Smash at Five Destroyers, Cargo Ship -- Kiska Assaults Go On FIGHT IN SOLOMONS; ZEROS ARE ROUTED RENEWED JAPANESE ACTIVITY IN SOLOMONS COUNTERED

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 2 -- United States fighter planes, beating back what was believed to have been a strong attempt by the Japanese Air Force to attack the American airfield on Guadalcanal Island, shot down sixteen enemy Zeros yesterday, Solomon Islands time, the Navy reported today in a communique.
abstract: US fighter planes down 16 Zeros of 30-40 believed attempting raid on Guadalcanal; 6 US planes lost; See Knox comments; US planes attack Jap surface force southwest of Kolombangara and Jap installations, Suavanau Plantation, Santa Isabel Is; map
